CountEvaluation¶

Algorithms to evaluate the observed counts from a sequence of experiments: This is used for simple averaging but also for different state detection algorithms

algorithms are expected to defined the fileds as stated in MeanEvaluation

class DoubleRangeEvaluation(globalDict={}, settings=None)¶

simple threshold state detection: if more than threshold counts are observed the ion is considered bright. For threshold photons or less it is considered dark.

children()¶
evaluate(data, evaluation, expected=None, ppDict=None, globalDict=None)¶
name = 'Double Count Range'¶
setDefault()¶
tooltip = ''¶
class FeedbackEvaluation(globalDict={}, settings=None)¶

returns mean and shot noise error

children()¶
evaluate(data, evaluation, expected=None, ppDict=None, globalDict=None)¶
evaluateMinMax(countarray)¶
name = 'Feedback'¶
setDefault()¶
sourceType¶

alias of Enum

tooltip = 'Slow feedback on external parameter'¶
class FidelityEvaluation(globalDict={}, settings=None)¶

simple threshold state detection: if more than threshold counts are observed the ion is considered bright. For threshold photons or less it is considered dark. In addition it receives the expected state and calculates the fidelity

ExpectedLookup = {'d': 0, 'i': 0.5, '-i': 0.5, '1': 0.5, '-1': 0.5, 'u': 1}¶
children()¶
evaluate(data, evaluation, expected=None, ppDict=None, globalDict=None)¶
name = 'Fidelity'¶
setDefault()¶
tooltip = 'Obove threshold is bright'¶

class TwoIonFidelityEvaluation(globalDict={}, settings=None)¶

simple threshold state detection: if more than threshold counts are observed the ion is considered bright. For threshold photons or less it is considered dark. In addition it receives the expected state and calculates the fidelity
